Articles.Content:
Jeb's on his way to the SUN!

Not really. I'm doing one of those "leave Kerbin's SOI for fifteen seconds to get some quick science" missions and I thought Jeb deserved the honor. He should be back in about two weeks >.<
In orbit around Duna. Was about to dock with the nuke engine when I by accident jettisoned the docking ring...
Currently at Eve's North pole:
Currently resting in the astronaut complex. Well deserved after a science expedition to the mun.

Jeb is right now at ksc, always complaining about my designs, like "MORE BOOOSTERS", "struts are overrated","thats not wobbly enough to feel comfortable", "the Snack compartment is way to small", "the rover is to slow"...

i think even Bill and Bob were mumbling about forgetting someone on the next Mission.

In the VAB, Waiting for a crew transfer mission to Polaris Station.

Meanwhile, he is complaining the rocket needs MOAR BOOSTER or something like that.

In the astronauts complex waiting for a manned mission.

I'm currently making more unmanned missions than manned one, mainly because my missions to Duna which should have landed a basic rover have ALL failed.

Jebediah claim he's not related to those failure, after all it's not like he would that I abandon my rover and get back to manned missions
Commanding Mustang 1, the first trip to Duna in my current save. He has a 152 day wait for a return window.

In orbit around Duna. Was about to dock with the nuke engine when I by accident jettisoned the docking ring...

Still in orbit around Duna, but now together with Bob. Engineering forgot to connect fuel hoses to the nuke engines... 2nd rescue mission will soon reach them.
Sat in my portable Kethane miner on Minmus waiting for the orbital refueling station to pass overhead for a rendezvous

Dead I went to launch a rocket and found it lacked sufficient struts and I'd forgotten to set up the abort action. I tried to get away by spamming space and actually managed to get the command pod detached and chutes deployed barely above the ground, but then other parts of the rocket slammed into it.
He's at the KSC bar waiting for a mission. I probably won't hire him in this current savegame because I want to hire new fresh Kerbals.

He's safely back on terra (Kerra?) firma after a somewhat hairy reentry in my light SSTO. His mission did, however, confirm that all my pre-FAR planes (this being the last one to test) do still work, aside from a little canard-position-tweaking.

It only spun out once, though Bill might have been a little sick at that point. At least glass cockpits are easy to clean.

Mine has delivered a mobile base to Laythe, and then brutally demolished it.

He wasn't very content with it.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Dead on Mun.

The descent stage of Munraker mk.7 landed too hard, and one of the engines crashed on the surface, leaving the craft useless for the ascent.

A rescue mission has been promptly set up, but it took too long to reach the crash site; the MM batteries died, and all was left of good ol' Jeb when the automated rescue ship finally made it to the Mun was a whiff of that smoke kerbals leave behind when their life support expires. Sadly, mrs. Kerman doesn't even have a grave to mourn.

Bob Kerman, with Munraker mk.9, left a flag and a plaque where Jeb left us. I think I have a pic somewhere.

Jeb is right now on Gilly, with no rocket (Kraken attack), no company (after the kraken attack Bill and Bob went MIA) and, most importantly, NO SNACKS!

I've watched Scott Manley's longest EVA ever a few times, and now that the planets have more or less aligned I'm gonna try to get him home, where Bill and Bob will hopefully appear in the Astronaut Complex one of these days.

My jeb is on an escape velocity out of the solar system after a failed encounter with Jool because I was off galavanting around Duna gettin science. But hey.. he has 2 other guys to keep him company/cannibalize.

Career mode: After several orbital missions Jeb is now mostly working in the Aerospace division test piloting aircraft.

Sandbox: Jeb is part of a three man crew of an extended mission to dock with and rescue any ships or crew in Kerbin space that become distressed.

Jeb just took up permanent residence on his new asteroid in Kerbin orbit.

dat view tho...
My Jebediah is safely in a polar orbit. I sent him there, because I want to keep him safe and there is no safer place.

My Jebediah is safely in a polar orbit. I sent him there, because I want to keep him safe and there is no safer place.

You know, every asteroid I've tried to capture so far came in on a polar trajectory
Jeb is in an orbit around the sun. Bill is in orbit around Kerbin. Both are out of fuel and need rescuing. They're gonna have a long wait.
My Jeb is stuck on the Mun at the moment. It was one of those "I'm bored, let's go to the Mun!" moments. We just haven't felt like recovering him yet.
Mine is at KSC, testing out all my crazy, stupid, useless contraptions.
Mine is messing with the nav nodes trying to return from pol.
